Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: May draw basic shapes intended to represent different habitats (e.g., a blob for land and a blob for water) but with little detail.
Might include some simple living things, such as a tree or fish, but without clear distinction between habitats.
Could attempt to label one or two elements, but labels might not correlate accurately with drawings or elements present.
CANNOT: Is unable to clearly identify or distinguish between a land habitat and a water habitat. (e.g., may put water animals in land habitat or vice versa)
Likely cannot draw a variety of living things or differentiate between plants and animals in each habitat; may include random or inappropriate living things.
Does not compare or label the different types of plants and animals accurately; may label incorrectly or omit labels entirely. (student doesnâ€™t know the different living things)
Cannot organize the drawings to show patterns of plant and animal diversity in each habitat; lacks understanding of ecosystem diversity.
